meanings.definition: Choose or select (someone or something) beforehand.
meanings.sent1: She was preselecting the winners of the contest before the event.
meanings.sent2: The team is preselecting the candidates for the job interview next week.
meanings.sent3: The magician preselected the card to make it disappear in his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preselects the questions to surprise the students during the quiz.
meanings.sent5: By preselecting the ingredients, the chef ensures a smooth cooking process.

meanings.sent1: Before the trip, they were preselecting the places they wanted to visit.
meanings.sent2: The committee is preselecting the topics for the upcoming conference.
meanings.sent3: The detective preselected the suspect to test his investigative skills.
meanings.sent4: She preselects the outfits for the week to save time in the mornings.
meanings.sent5: By preselecting the songs, the DJ keeps the party going smoothly.
